title: Calories in a Slice of Ham
meta_description: Discover calories in a slice of ham, including protein, fat, sodium, and full nutrition breakdown per slice with quick tweaks and FAQs.
h1: Calories in a Slice of Ham
assumptions: Standard deli slice of cooked, cured ham (~28 g or 1 oz), thinly sliced, no added condiments.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, curing method, thickness, and additives; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A typical slice of ham contains ~45 kcal and ~5 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Glazed with honey (1 tsp per slice)

faqs.q: How many calories in a slice of ham?
faqs.a: About 45 kcal for a standard 28 g deli slice.
Yes, a slice typically has ~300 mg sodium due to curing.

faqs.q: What's the protein in one slice of ham?

faqs.a: Minimal, about 1 g carbs per slice from added sugars in curing.

faqs.q: How does slice thickness affect calories?
faqs.a: Thicker slices can double calories to ~90 kcal; always weigh for accuracy.
